meanings.definition: Immature cells in the bone marrow that give rise to granulocytes.
meanings.sent1: The myeloblasts are young cells in the bone marrow.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study myeloblasts to understand how white blood cells develop.
meanings.sent3: The myeloblasts were like little helpers in the bone marrow, growing into strong defenders.
meanings.sent4: In the marrow garden, myeloblasts are the seeds that bloom into protective soldiers.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the myeloblasts as tiny warriors training to fight infections.

meanings.definition: A type of precursor cell involved in the production of white blood cells.
meanings.sent1: White blood cells start from myeloblasts.
meanings.sent2: The myeloblasts play a crucial role in creating our defense system.
meanings.sent3: The myeloblasts were like the architects of the immune system, designing the white blood cells.
meanings.sent4: Within the body's factory, myeloblasts are the workers crafting the white blood cells.
meanings.sent5: Picture the myeloblasts as builders constructing the army of white blood cells.

meanings.definition: Cells that differentiate into myeloid cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists observe how myeloblasts change into specialized cells.
meanings.sent3: The myeloblasts were like shape-shifters, turning into different cell types.
meanings.sent4: As the chameleons of the body, myeloblasts adapt into various myeloid cells.
meanings.sent5: Visualize the myeloblasts as versatile artists creating different myeloid cells.
